publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4098 Mrs Margaret Ewing: Jimmy "Jinky" Johnstone—That the Parliament notes the sad passing of Celtic and Scotland legend, Jimmy Johnstone, whose footballing skill and trickery entertained and amazed thousands of football fans worldwide; further notes that Johnstone was a cornerstone of the first British team to win the European Cup and that Celtic fans bestowed on him the honour of being named Celtic’s greatest-ever player; notes that Johnstone also became a strong campaigner for raising awareness of motor neurone disease, and hopes that his campaign will continue to tackle this crippling disease. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson*, Campbell Martin*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Des McNulty*, Rob Gibson*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Brian Adam*, Fiona Hyslop* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-4098 Jimmy "Jinky" Johnstone (lodged on 13 March 2006) Jackie Baillie*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Christine Grahame*, Margaret Mitchell*, Robin Harper*, Mike Pringle*, Jim Mather*, Karen Gillon*, Carolyn Leckie*, Michael Matheson*, Phil Gallie*, Colin Fox*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Tommy Sheridan*, Richard Lochhead*, Mark Ballard*, Alex Neil*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-4098 Jimmy "Jinky" Johnstone (lodged on 13 March 2006) Mr Bruce McFee*, Pauline McNeill*
S2M-4098 Jimmy "Jinky" Johnstone (lodged on 13 March 2006) Rosie Kane*, Ms Sandra White*

S2M-4098 Mrs Margaret Ewing: Jimmy "Jinky" Johnstone—That the Parliament notes the sad passing of Celtic and Scotland legend, Jimmy Johnstone, whose footballing skill and trickery entertained and amazed thousands of football fans worldwide; further notes that Johnstone was a cornerstone of the first British team to win the European Cup and that Celtic fans bestowed on him the honour of being named Celtic’s greatest-ever player; notes that Johnstone also became a strong campaigner for raising awareness of motor neurone disease, and hopes that his campaign will continue to tackle this crippling disease. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Campbell Martin, Bruce Crawford, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Des McNulty, Rob Gibson, Roseanna Cunningham, Brian Adam, Fiona Hyslop, Jackie Baillie, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Christine Grahame, Margaret Mitchell, Robin Harper, Mike Pringle, Jim Mather, Karen Gillon, Carolyn Leckie, Michael Matheson, Phil Gallie, Colin Fox, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Tommy Sheridan, Richard Lochhead, Mark Ballard, Alex Neil, Mr Brian Monteith, Marilyn Livingstone, Eleanor Scott, Mr Bruce McFee, Pauline McNeill, Rosie Kane, Ms Sandra White
S2M-4098 Jimmy "Jinky" Johnstone (lodged on 13 March 2006) Donald Gorrie*
